page.title: 03INFANT CARE
page.content: Expectant mothers are cared for by the GP in Hay, Builth or Knighton. Families tend to use the GP base of past generations but newcomers go to Hay. Clinics are now available for weekly help. There are maternity wards at Hereford, Brecon and Builth hospitals. A health visitor visits within 48 hours of the mother returning home. Few babies suffer real illness and in the past 10 years none have died. There is no official midwife in the area. Parents look after the little ones but it is the mothers responsibility for the hour to hour care. Dad often cares for children in the evening so allowing young mothers to join clubs and classes. Grandparents often live nearby and play an active part in many childrens lives. They support them well during their primary school life.
